Message.Title: Undervalued Low Floater to Breakout Big this Afternoon
Message.Msg: Concurrent (CCUR) - undervalued low floater - about to break $8 and explode to double digits to double to reach fair valuation vs. its #1 rival Seachange (SEAC). Technically, CCUR has gained 12 straight months and 8 of the past 9 trading days, but its gains have been slow and steady. CCUR has the best looking chart with the most momentum in the market, and is not even close to its peak. CCUR is currently $7.91 and as soon as it breaks through the key $8 resistance level early this week, it will rapidly rally to double digits. 9.3mm shares have traded since Feb 1st vs. CCUR's 9.2mm s/o, so the $8 resistance most be almost completely gone. CCUR's net income last quarter was up 100% from previous quarter and up 300% from two quarters ago. CCUR has $24.6mm or $2.67 per share in cash and no debt. After subtracting its cash per share from share price, its business is worth $5.24 per share. CCUR's non-GAAP EPS last quarter of $0.125 equals $0.50 annualized, valuing CCUR's business at only 10X earnings. CCUR has $62.59mm or $6.80 per share in revenue, also valuing its business at only 0.77X revenue. SEAC is now $11.89 and expected to report on 4/9 full year non-GAAP EPS of $0.40, giving it a P/E of 30. With CCUR's latest annualized non-GAAP EPS of $0.50 a P/E of 30 would value CCUR at $15 per share. CCUR is the leading video on demand (VOD) technology provider and has deployed their solutions with Time Warner Cable (TWC), Cox, Charter (CHTR), and Bright House. CCUR's technology is in 23mm U.S. households and 54mm homes worldwide. CCUR's business is about to explode from the new multi-screen spending boom set to take place in the cable TV industry. CCUR's MediaHawk Multi-Screen Video Delivery Platform was just selected by Virgin Media (VMED) to power their Virgin TV Anywhere platform.

Topic.Title: EBAY RAISING FEES AGAIN UNDER GUISE OF LOWERING THEM

Message.Msg: How can you make such blatantly untrue statements. How can the analyst on wall st. not see the negative aspects of this fee increaase. Sellers like me will NO LONGER BE ABLE TO SELL ON EBAY. I list about 100 items a month. It costs me 50 cents each to list, and I do not have a store. That is a grand total of $50 in up front costs. Period. I sell about 40 items a month, with an average selling price of $1800. The final value fee on each of those items will increase by at least $100. That is an increase of $4000 in final value fees. How can saving $50 in listing fees possibly offset an additional $4000 in final value fees! Not to mention that I now will have to subscribe to a store, and I also have to pay a 9% FVF on the shipping! I don't have the margins to absorb those kinds of increases.

Yes they have the whole banana BUT they also have a terrible attitude, which in my estimation needs some serious adjustment. They are worse than any cell phone company that has existed, they are worse than every cable company. They lie, they cheat , they steal, but most of all they think they know about things than sellers. What they shoudl be called and where they should be listed, and if they can be sold. THEY KNOW NOTHING. Absolutely nothing. Any seller who has ever sold will tell you the same thing. They reward CROOKS and steal from, honest people. Before you buy the stock, sell for 1 week and you most likely will quit. The reason there are sellers because they have been there for years. There are no new sellers, and they wont be any! Once there is an alternative, Ebay will make news bigger, larger faster, than the demise of a president. Trust me. We all hate em. lastly when the tax man commeth, that will be the final blow, and he will be coming. There is already a 20k limit , then you get a 1099K. Topic.Title: EBAY RAISING FEES AGAIN UNDER GUISE OF LOWERING THEM

Message.Title: 350% increase in Final Value Fee
Message.Msg: Just to clarify this for those of you who do not understand simple math. The new ebay final value fee is going up 350% on everything over $1000. Ebay may try to say that it is only a 7% increase, but they obviously do not know how to do simple math. The current fee for items sold for over $1000 is $62.50 plus 2% of the amount over $1000. That means 6.25% for the first $1000 and 2% for the rest. The new fee is a flat 9%. While the difference between 2% and 9% is 7%, it is not a 7% increase. A 7 % increase on 2% would be to raise it to 2.14%. The real increase is 7/2 which is 3.5, or a 350% increase.

Topic.Title: EBAY RAISING FEES AGAIN UNDER GUISE OF LOWERING THEM

Message.Msg: If the fee goes from 2% to 9%, it is more than tripling. That is what is happening. I started a new topic on this if you don't understand the math.

Topic.Title: 350% increase in Final Value Fee

Message.Msg: Are you math challenged or what? Right now it's $62.50 for $1000 At 9% it will be $90 for $1000 An increase of about 50% on items over $1000 I'm a High School Dropout and can do the math. . .

Topic.Title: 350% increase in Final Value Fee

Message.Msg: Are you unable to read also? It is an increase of 46% on an item priced AT $1000. It is a 350% increase on the amount OVER $1000. So on a $2000 item, you have an increase of 46% for the first half of it and an increase of 350% on the other half. Isn't a 50% increase too much even with your high school dropout math?

Topic.Title: 350% increase in Final Value Fee

Message.Msg: On a $2000 item it is $62.50 for the first $1000 and $20 for the second $1000 for a total of $82.50 The new fee rates at flat 9% will be $90 for the first $1000 and $90 for the second $1000 for a total of $180. Maximum fee is capped at $250, so people selling items the $1000-$3000 range will take the biggest hit. Then again, a quick glance at ebay_pays_my_bills store shows he has 55 items listed, most in the $10-$20 range, highest item at $249. Obviously using the 50 free listings, no store, no listing fees and not selling anything of any real value so these changes don't hurt him, however, with his self-admitted lack of education, lack of business and too much time on his hands, he's only here to stir emotions.
